Comment: Yeah, Iâ€™m not confident if this is net positive or negative for space flight. Sls was incredibly expensive, it will be interesting to see if spacex can reduce the cost to deep space in the same way they did access to the iss. I agree though that there needs to be more than one contractor that can provide the service.
Author: jackblackbackinthesa

Comment: Honestly, the fact that they didn't have an actual, suitable replacement that wasn't just reusing stuff in place going back to the shuttle era was a bad sign. The problem is as people like Neil Degrasse Tyson has pointed out for over a decade, space flight doesn't capture the public's attention like it did during the Mercury/Gemini/Apollo/Skylab/early Shuttle eras. 40+ years in LEO has made the public 'meh' on it. And Republicans going hardcore anti-science doesn't help.   If we had an admin that had the same passion for space exploration that JFK did, the results would be amazing.
Author: Hornpipe_Jones
